ContentClassification.TableReference: A. S. MacDonald, "The Second Actuarial Study of Mortality in Europe" (1997) Accessed November, 2012 from http://www.actuaris.com/fr/infotech/actuariat/tables_de_mortalit-/table_tprv_93.html.
ContentClassification.TableDescription: TPRV 93 – Table for Prospective Annuity. Basis: Unisex. Minimum Age: 0. Maximum Age: 113
ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: TPRV 93 is a predicative table showing the complete life expectancy of a cohort for 1950 made by Institut National de la Statistique et des Études Économiques (INSEE) based on extrapolation of studies on mortality for generations between 1887 and 1993. The table was adopted in 1993 as an alternative to prospective generational table TPG 1887-1993 (See SOA Table Identity 32001) for use in the calculation of life annuity benefits and is based on the mortality of women. TPV 93 was superseded by sex-distinct tables TG05F and TG05H adopted in 2007. Use of the table for a generation other than 1950 requires application of a shift. Methodology: Female mortality data of 1961-1987, in 5-year age groups were used. For the fixed ages, crude rates were interpolated and extrapolated giving mortality rates defined by a polynomial function. Mortality rates at individual ages were obtained by assuming an exponential progression between each 5-year age group, for each fixed time. The table for 1950 cohort was then published with age adjustments for other generations: <1900 = +6, 1900-1909 = +5, 1910-1919 = +4, 1920-1930 = +3 1931-1938 = +2, 1939-1946 = +1, 1947-1952 = +0, 1953-1959 = -1 1960-1965 = -2, 1966-1970 = -3, 1971-1978 = -4, >1978 = -5 13. Note that the source material contained Lx and thus was converted to qx for purposes of this table. Data Transcriptions Errors: None. Data Certified: 11/2012

MetaData.TableDescription: TPRV 93 – Table for Prospective Annuity. Basis: Unisex. Minimum Age: 0. Maximum Age: 113
